column4: Is there a full-proof way to clone a ubuntu install from one HDD to another?
well I can't boot with both HDDs installed, and I can't seem to run a livecd that has mount and rsync
you can install rsync on the live cd
but ive never really heard of a live cd that lacks mount...
I can't run a normal livecd, had to install with alternate
if you have thing on your panel that arent installed by default, youll get errors in gnome tilyou install them

i suggest using "dpkg --get-selections >> packages.list" on the old machine and "dpkg --set-selections < packages.list" on the new machine, then install and run "sudo dselect" and tell it to install. itll reinstall everything you had before. do that from a terminal before logging into gnome
what about things like window managers and stuff? I messsed around with blackbox and am still using it
whatver you have set to run by default when you login ought to be installed when you first login if you want to avoid errors
that dpkg stuff i said will make whats installed on the new one match what was on the old one
what about the configurations I've made, how do I keep those?
if theyre for your user, they are in your home directory
if they're for the system, theyre in /etc
